DataElement.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Other Anatomic Site Involvement Occurrence Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe another site that was involved with acute graft versus host disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Other Anatomic Site Involvement Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, usually affecting the skin, liver, and GI tract. The onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._Named locations of or within the body._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, usually affecting the skin, liver, and GI tract. The onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Named locations of or within the body.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.
